title.narrative: Using deforestation-free commodity supply chains to support national initiatives to combat forest loss

description.narrative: Companies at all stages in palm oil, rubber, cocoa and timber/fibre supply chains are disconnected from national and subnational policy and governance processes to reduce deforestation. The project will provide guidance for companies on how to support specific, nationally-led processes to reduce deforestation in Indonesia, Ghana, Liberia and Cameroon, and how to implement social safeguards around land use governance at landscape scale. It will provide tools for Chinese companies to adopt more responsible sourcing practices and Chinese institutions to take more leadership in global sustainability processes. Lessons and case studies will inform COP 26 and offer models for scaling up.

recipient-country.narrative:
CCCMC and other initiatives signed MoU to strengthen their collaboration
Final implementation tools developed and incorporated into SNR Guidance
Three workshops or webinars conducted for the palm oil downstream players in China

Guidance for companies on engagement with respective policy process finalised
Guidance on minimum human right safeguards at landscape level piloted at district level
Case study to address deforestation outside concessions added to Guidance for Private sector to engage in landscape initiative.

National Guidance on engagement incorporates lessons on HRIA and stakeholder engagement in landscape
Key Lessons from the development and operations of the Asunafo-Asutifi Landscape programme documented
The capacity of companies, state actors and local community enhanced for effective engagement at the landscape level

National strategy and action plan/road map validated and disseminated
REDD+ process revitalised with the involvement of the private sector
HCV identified (further investigate HCV presence) in priority area in Mabangassina in the framework of land use planning process

Private sector engaged with the national oil palm strategy
Guidance for FPIC in the context of the 2018 Land Rights Law available for the private sector
Government initiate action to harmonise policies on deforestation, gender and conservation
